newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli helicopters strike south of Beirut.
newsitem.headline: Israeli helicopters strike south of Beirut.

text.p: Israeli helicopters raided Palestinian guerrilla targets on hilltops south of Beirut on Saturday, security sources said.

Two helicopters fired two rockets at the Na'ameh hills 15 km (nine miles) south of Beirut, where the radical Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine General Command (PFLP-GC) has bases, they said.
The security sources said there were no immediate reports of casualties in the raid.
Lebanese army units fired anti-aircraft guns at the Israeli helicopters but they were not hit, the sources said.
